Hello :"<? input.text ?>", Program Advisor(s). How may i help you today ?. 
Listed below are the SDPA modules for your support and assistance. 
Click on the desired modules or enter your question / query.

`1. T-24 means 24 weeks to the Event Date.`
After you obtain the Date from customer , enter the date range in the PRISM tool
work with Schedulers for confirming the date
Take Customers  consent
Confirm the Scheduled date in the PRISM 
Once confirmed , communicate with customer through SAP tool.
During T-24 , as an SDPA ,  Initiate communication to the customer and ensure following steps are done before T-16
2. During T-24 to T-16 ensure, initiate the communication with customers.
3. Check if the customer is looking for any DR Event schedule.
4. Request Customer for any Contract updates
5. Check if any risks are involved 
6.  Check if any additional requirement like POC / Mini test / Nettest etc

Review and understand the contract 
Identify Key stakeholders
Initiate communication with stakeholder and  follow T-20 - T1 Process
`In - Detail::-`
1.  Logon to SAP and read the contract thoroughly and understand over all solution and if there  
     are shared contracts between multiple companies .
2.  Thoroughly conduct stakeholders analysis 
3. Check for any already scheduled dates in the system (SAP & PRISM)
4. check for usage history and check for available hrs and events.
5. Check for any previous issues in SAP.
6. Understand Visio diagram and other deliverable s if available from previous event.
7. Check for communication Log and event logs.
8. Introduce yourself to the customer and mark cc to your Account Manager
9. Request for Scheduling an event if not scheduled yet ?
10. Learn T-24 Process

The Rapid Open Provisioning (ROP) portal is a website that allows customers to provide to IBM with information with which to set up their Intel / Client-Server environment.  ROP accepts data regarding UCS Blades* (e.g. compute resources/environment), legacy physical servers such as IBM 3850 C's etc, and VDI requirements.  A customer enters their "project" (e.g. their recovery data) into the portal so we have it for tests and at time of the disaster, similarly to having information on file in the form of a worksheet.  The advantage of using ROP is that it allows IBM Resiliency Services to employ automation to deploy the project and build the recovery environment quickly, giving our customers a faster RPO.

Link for IRP::- <https://www.ibm.com/services/us-en/it-services/business-continuity/resiliency-portal/|IRP DashBoard> 


Link for ROP ::- <https://ropus.mybluemix.net/secure/|ROP4 Access>
<https://ropus.mybluemix.net/secure/index.html#/project/new|ROP Project>

`Introduction to ROP4 : `

IBM Resiliency Services is pleased to inform you that we are upgrading our Rapid Open Provisioning portal (ROP).  The new version will be in place effect from November 2019.  Your URL and login process is provided here for your ready reference . The display is  upgraded and the options enhanced.  

Updated features include:
More user-friendly layout
Print function added
Section for non-UCS/legacy Intel hardware (e.g. 3850's, HPDL's, etc.) 
Support for VDI workplace and tape libraries
Help page button to display user's guide
and more...

During Initiation Process:

Inputs:  SOW / Contract 
Tools used:   SAP / PRISM / IRP
Output:  Planned Scheduled Date 
--------------------------------------
* INITIATE: During this phase 
- we either go at client OR them at us, requesting a test date
-we go at scheduling to secure a test date
-we then work with the client to either confirm or reschedule their event until a beneficial and agreed-to event date is secured
-we provide all needed information to client once event in confirmed.
---------------------------------------

`IRP Link :`  <https://www.ibm.com/services/us-en/it-services/business-continuity/resiliency-portal/ target=resiliency|IRP DashBoard> 

`PRISM  Link :`  <https://ppywdcwebp201.sl.bluecloud.ibm.com/bcrs/prism target=resiliency|PRISM LINK>

*Initiation Process*
`Inputs	`			`Outputs`					`Tools`				`Process - HighLevel`
Contract				Scheduled Date				SAP				INITIATE:
SOW													we either go at client OR them at us, requesting a test date
Add .requirements								IRP				we go at scheduling to secure a test date by creating Work order in PRISM 
									PRISM				we then work with client to either confirm or reschedule their event until a beneficial and agreed-to event date is secured
													we provide all needed information to client once event in confirmed.
													Ensure Confirmation letter and Data removal form sent to the customer
													Check Contract upgrade is required 
													Check if Client is Onboarded to IRP.
Hello! I am a virtual assistant (cross domain bot),designed to answer your questions about the Resiliency Services !. What should I call you?

Perform Exercise simulation to know additional event charges before scheduling.  
Follow the steps below :
Logon to SAP, open your customer record, click on support -. Usage - > Exercise simulation

For any site access/escort support/proximity operation ( any support on your COE / DCFS ) from IBM personnel, please create a service request using the SRT Orchestra tool for respective support.

<https:https://www.ibm.com/easytools/runtime/hsp4/protect/orchestra/R01/Home.wss|SRT Link> 

" Following steps are required while Refreshment , upgrade , addtional COE , replacement / Installation etc.
1. Please work with AM to update the contract with complete details 
2. Ensure contract is singed off before shipment of the equipment
 3. Incase any delay in singing the contract , customer can ship the equipment with autherization to to receice the equipment by IBM and keep in secure place until contrc signed off and installtion is initiated .. For autherization please cont SDPA ( Autherization) 
4.  For installation create SRT and workwith SDAP .."

For any site access / escort support / proximity operation ( any support on your COE / DCFS ) from IBM personnel , please create a service request using SRT Orchistra tool for respective support. 
<https://www-01.ibm.com/easytools/runtime/hsp4/protect/bcrsglobal/index.wss|SRT Orchestration>

The IBM call handler will gather information specific to your company, such as contact information, the status of your situation and your contact numbers. The call handler will then notify the IBM Business Resiliency Services Emergency Response Manager. The Emergency Response Manager will review the information we have on file for your company and then call back to review information with you or speak with you about which IBM Site will be supporting your recovery.

`1.Contact scheduling to confirm that the needed shared hardware is available for extending`
2. Contact each applicable platform lead and get approval that they can support the extension from a staffing perspective.( Refer T-10 grid for all contact details)
	Management 
	Network support
	Open Systems support (RISC, HP, SUN, TANDEM, Intel, etc)
	IBMi support
	Large Systems support 
Notify above team on event extension confirmation once all approved ..
3. III.	If EMC DASD scheduled, contact the EMC focal to alert them of the extension and include EMC on the email distribution list.
	Carlos Navia - 303-961-3620 (BLD EMC Focal)
	Peter Wong (EMC) - peter.l.wong@emc.com - 845-857-0968
4. Contact Sterling Forest, Gaithersburg, and\or Regional Recovery Center and support teams if there is equipment allocated to inform them of the extension.
5. Send an e-mail to the Rapid Recovery PSM and notify the Rapid Recovery Operations team, if applicable.
6. Send an e-mail to Boulder BCRS All informing of the extension with the following details.
	Which contracts and platforms will be extended
	How many hours the extension will be for
	The previous and new end time for the event.  
The reason for the extension (if known)."
So, what's next I can assist you with ?

The Duty Manager / SDPA  should deal with following Activities
*Customer Emergency Response (ER)

3. Once you receive the date from customer within T-10 time frame,  the step is enter dates in PRISM and ask schedulers to check if resources are available .

7. Rest all same as normal planning process.

`* CLOSEOUT:`
-Understand from client when event is complete, be it being told OR knowing otherwise
-Obtain device configurations as needed prior to teardown (e.g., CISCO device configs)
-Inform appropriate groups via email of event being complete
-Inform rapid recovery if needed so disconnects between IBM RS and client can occur
-Work as needed with media management to get client media and eqpt shipped back
-Understand how the environment might have changed during event, and notate any changes to client so worksheets can be modified with the new requirements
-Work with infrastructure on any additional connects / changes being needed as a result of discovery from the event
-Understand fully if any waivers are needed prior to billing, and if a re-test is needed
-Bill event as needed per usage for the event
-Follow through on survey with client if needed
-Arrange and hold Post Test Review if needed:
--obtain specific issues from client

`Why are we charging our clients .`
	We no longer offer any give-aways during an exercise.  Additional hardware or services may now be secured for a one time fee in the event contract revisions are not effective prior to the start date of the exercise.  
	A core team of Service Delivery personnel will be authorized to generate a One Time Charge for the client, via SAP and a Work Authorization for Additional Services. 
`Our Role.`
Send request for One Time Charge to a team member for processing and copy BCRS Upgrades/Gaithersburg/IBM.
`One Time Charge Focal Points`
`One Time Charge Request Form`
`Processing of One Time Charges`
After client and IBM signatures have been obtain, scan the Work Authorization and store in COMDOC as SALES - Letter of Authorization.  For IGA Accounts, an email approval of the Work Authorization is acceptable.  Please generate a PDF of the email and store in COMDOC as above.
`Post Event Activities.`
At the completion of the clients exercise, send the required documentation to the Contract Operations Team (copying BCRS Upgrades/Gaithersburg/IBM).  
`Running/Viewing Your One Time Charge Report.`
From SAP Easy Access Menu.
Create OTC Report Shortcut.
`Creation of Forecast Records  Not Event Related.`
From Customer Information Search, left click on the contract associated with the charge.
`Creation of Forecast Records  Event Related.`
From Event Search, left click on the contract associated with the charge
`Creation of Forecast Records .`
Likelihood to bill guidelines:
Stretch  Opportunity has been identified, but, no commitment from customer.
At Risk  Opportunity has been identified and accepted by client, however, total amount may change and Release/Bill Month may change
Solid  Opportunity has been identified and accepted and charges will be released in the month forecasted
`Creation of Forecast Records .`
Release Month:
Indicates the Month/Year (MM/YYYY) in which the charge is to be released
Bill Month: 
Indicates the Month/Year (MM/YYYY) in which the charge is expected to bill.  Unless directed otherwise, Bill Month and Release Month should be the same.
Comments for Internal Use:
Indicate what is required before the charge can be released.
`Handling of Contract-Based One Time Charges .`
When work has been completed or milestone has been reached, advise Billing Focal that work has been completed and One Time Charge can be released.
 Open the Forecast Record:
Ensure Likelihood to Bill = Solid
Ensure Bill Mo and Release Mo accurately reflect when the Billing Focal was advised that the charge could be released
Ensure the Forecast Actual represents the correct One Time Charge value
 Click on Submit (If charge type is Other, click on Release).
Next Steps -  Create/Update Forecast Records.
Open your One Time Charge report to review for accuracy 
 System generated One Time Charges are on your report now for events in the next 6 months.  Update the Likelihood to Bill, Bill Month and Release Month, and provide any pertinent comments in Comments for Internal Use
 If you know for certain a system generated charge is going to be waived, update Forecast Assessed to reflect $0 and provide detail in Comments for Internal Use
 For non system generated charges, create the Forecast Records
 For Revenue Split contracts, if you know SO is going to be covering the charge, you can use this opportunity to request the accounting codes that will be used.
`Web Based Charges (Orchestra / SRT).`
When you receive Cost Valuation Reports
Review Client Contract (Billable or Accumulated)
If billable, generate forecast charge and send spreadsheet to billing focal

During Outage emergency :

1. Call 1-877-IBM-REC1 (1-877-426-7321)  select option1
2.  Say that, you wish to declare a disaster to activate your contract(s) .
3.  The IBM call handler will gather information specific to your company, such 
      as contact information, the status of your situation, and your contact numbers.

`During Execution:`
`Inputs:`  Deliverables / Plan douments
`Outputs:`  OTC requests , Events extensions , Test results , Lesson learned
`Tools: ` SAP , Email Approvals , PRISM , Work Autherizations
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
`Process:`
**NOTE:  Execute and Control are both cycles that occur when the event is running, and are thus very interconnecting**
*EXECUTE:
-Either meet client in suite OR technical area such as tape room to kickoff event if attendees are on site.  Kick off via phone call if remote
-Introduce floor support and other needed personnel (RR, APSU, AT&T, RPE Resources) to client
-Show client around as needed including tape drives, COE, equipment, servers
-Engage skills teams at event start, to work with client or provide contact information
-Assure all rules of media management are fully known to all.

* CONTROL:
-Work with client on event scope creep such as additional resources needed:
--tape drives, disk, additional system resources
--additional connects to COE / RR
--Connectivity issues
--Lack of knowledgebase by client, may need outside support.  One can draw on sales team and / or client exec for assistance
--Troubleshooting, to prove IBM RS is not at fault (e.g., loads on circuits / connections not pegged, status of switches and other interlinking devices)

-Enhance communications as needed between skills teams and client
-Maintain contact with client through periodic "check ins"
-Engage media team as needed for escalations / assistance as needed
-Work with client to understand if additional test time is needed / warranted.  If so, work with floor teams, rapid recovery, scheduling, and management as needed, and communicate as needed so all teams are aware.
*********************************************************************************************************************************************************************

Execution _ M&C	
Inputs			Outputs			Tools					Process High Level

*Use Case*
`Request any input/help on this - one of my customer asking for a SOA/Quote for any SRT Activities.   They want to send few tapes over to RTP to be inserted and have any tapes existing in the I/O hopper (COE) be sent back at the same time.   As per SRT, this activity covers under Item Code : xxx.xx with rate code A i.e, $ xxx per hour.     Already informed the customer on the rates and activities.  But, still they are looking for a quote/soa for thier internal account purpose.    Do we provide such ? if so, should I follow OTC process to WA ?`

The orchestration for IBM Resiliency Services (SRT)

For onboarding following are the steps:
1) Getting Started ***Request IBM ID 

Access to the Orchestra solution uses the IBM web ID. The users need to register their IDs and passwords on ibm.com. After the IBM ID is registered, then they should have access to the Orchestra. Please create the ID using their email addresses provided earlier. If this is not possible, then please send us the new ID so we can update their profile in Orchestra.

To register with ibm.com:
1) Go to <https://www.ibm.com/account/profile/us|IBM ID>
2) Click on Register in the right navigation

3) Enter your current business e-mail address as the IBM ID. Enter the password that you would like to use (minimum 8 characters). Create a security question of your preference and enter the answer to your question. This will be useful should you forget your password. Enter your e-mail address and choose the country in which you reside. Click on Continue at the bottom of the page when done. `Process`
`NOTE:`  Monitoring and Control are both cycles that occur when the event is running, and are thus very interconnecting.

`MONITORING:`
-Either meet client in suite OR technical area such as tape room to kickoff event if attendees are on site.  Kick off via phone call if remote
-Introduce floor support and other needed personnel (RR, APSU, AT&T, RPE Resources) to client
-Show client around as needed including tape drives, COE, equipment, servers
-Engage skills teams at event start, to work with client or provide contact information
-Assure all rules of media management are fully known to all.

`CONTROL:`
-Work with client on event scope creep such as additional resources needed:
-tape drives, disk, additional system resources
-additional connects to COE / RR
-Connectivity issues
-Lack of knowledge base by client, may need outside support.  One can draw on sales team and / or client exec for assistance
-Troubleshooting, to prove IBM RS is not at fault (e.g., loads on circuits / connections not pegged, status of switches and other interlinking devices)

-Enhance communications as needed between skills teams and client
-Maintain contact with client through periodic "check ins"
-Engage media team as needed for escalations / assistance as needed
-Work with client to understand if additional test time is needed / warranted.  If so, work with floor teams, rapid recovery, scheduling, and management as needed, and communicate as needed so all teams are aware.

`*Outputs / Checklist`
-Issue logs.
-Lessons learned .
-Event success rating.

Your company can declare an Outage Emergency as defined in your IBM Business Resiliency Services contract(s). The contract defines an Outage Emergency as follows:   
An Outage Emergency is any unplanned interruption of your critical business and information processing at a Covered Address, resulting from causes beyond your control that significantly impairs your ability to operate your business.   
Some examples of an unplanned interruption include:  
  Building or region evacuation mandated by Public Authorities impacting access to buildings, systems, network, facilities  
  Destruction of systems or network due to a natural disaster (fire, flood, wind etc.) 
   Unanticipated loss of power or network   .
 
*There is a recovery only contract,  for the real disaster to activate,( In your case it is  CFXXXXX ) in the event of the real disaster. or to place an alert, as a proactive measure. 
*Look at the contract and discuss IBM RS contractual commitment for these, based on your contact entitlements: 
*Configuration turn-over (typically 24 hours, but not always). 
*Coldsite entitlements. 
*Discuss COE and COE network support.  (See Q&A below)
*Discuss the customer's responsibility for data erasure, the time needed to perform it, and *IBM RS's options for data erasure.  

`Client FAQs `
`Question:  When can you declare?  `
Answer: If you are under a state of Emergency causing loss of access to your site, road closures, evacuation orders -  that does qualify as a condition to declare.

`Question:  Can you send people in advance of the potential disaster?   `
Answer:  While we are available to respond to your needs, you can only send people to a delivery center after you have called in to declare an outage emergency and been placed in one of our delivery centers.

`Question:  Can you send tapes in advance?`
Answer:  Remind them to keep in mind, your placement in a IBM RS center is dependent on when you declare an outage emergency.  Therefore, if you send your tapes in advance you may need to arrange to ship the tapes to another location, if your placement location is not where you originally shipped them to

`Question:  Will IBM RS contact our network service provider about an outage on a circuit we own?  `
Answer:  No.  It is up to the circuit owner to work with the service provider.  IBM RScannot contact service providers for circuits on the customer's behalf.    

`Question:  What will IBM RS do to help diagnose customer owned circuit issues? ` 
Answer:  IBM RS will determine if the IBM RS environment is operational.  There may be a charge for more advanced problem determination activities.  After the current situation is resolved, your BCRS client representative will be happy to discuss options that would allow IBM RS to work with network connectivity vendors.

`Question:  What if the customer's BCP is out of synch with IBM RS's' contractual obligations?  `
Answer:  After the current situation is resolved, your IBM RSclient representative will be happy to discuss options that would more closely align IBM RS' contractual obligations with your BCP.
